title: UniCodec: Unified Audio Codec with Single Domain-Adaptive Codebook
author: Yidi Jiang (National University of Singapore), Qian Chen (Tongyi Speech Lab), Shengpeng Ji (Tongyi Speech Lab), Yu Xi (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Wen Wang (Tongyi Speech Lab), Chong Zhang (Tongyi Speech Lab), Xianghu Yue (National University of Singapore), Shiliang Zhang (Tongyi Speech Lab), Haizhou Li (Shenzhen Research Institute of Big Data, The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen)
relevance_why: The paper addresses audio codecs and their integration with large language models, aligning closely with my research interests in audio processing and enhancement. Techniques proposed can potentially enhance audio representation and synthesis tasks in my work.
background: The paper presents a method to create a low-bitrate unified audio codec that can handle various audio types like speech and music using a single codebook.
contribution: UniCodec introduces a unified audio codec with a single domain-adaptive codebook to handle multi-domain audio data, achieving improved audio reconstruction performance across speech, music, and sound.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models relied on multiple-layer quantizers, which complicated the autoregressive process in speech language models and resulted in higher latency.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances performance by employing a single-layer codebook and innovative domain-adaptive strategies through Mixture-of-Experts architecture.

key_innovation: It uniquely combines domain-specific codebook partitioning with a self-supervised training approach to enrich semantic information without auxiliary modules.
real_world_impact: The methodology has the potential to streamline audio processing in real-time applications, including speech recognition and music generation, thereby improving efficiency and user experience.
limitations: The authors mention that training can be disrupted by noisy or low-quality inputs, which may affect robustness in complex environments.

new_terms.Mixture-of-Experts: **Mixture-of-Experts** refers to a model architecture where a subset of 'experts' are activated to handle different tasks or domains, optimizing processing efficiency.
new_terms.partitioned domain-adaptive codebook: **Partitioned domain-adaptive codebook** indicates a codebook structure that is segmented to cater to different audio domains, enabling better representation of unique features within each domain.
